266CCB290B50439EA3F3B11ECF078613.description: Understand what language, expressions, tone and environment are appropriate for each media format.

F89A6841BC804A149BB3F74FA841A9EF.description: Consider what actions someone might take as a result of the media messages they consume (i.e. advocate, ask questions, change opinions).

A2642BEE7F044CB7A6BEAC68A6110C6A.description: Reflect on how media affects peoples’ lives, beliefs, needs and wants.

C0A53602066745A7BC2EA96720F03E4D.description: Reflect on personal experiences with media and explain how those experiences influence your reaction to new media sources.

79394B49220C4D4F96D85B04BD10A3A1.description: Investigate and discuss the cultural context in which media sources were created.

2AF0CBCF5D1B4547AB6C6793384C38BF.description: Incorporate new perspectives into your personal framework for understanding the world.

A0A85CD951BB4F76A23B995EAF5CA063.description: Actively seek to understand others’ perspectives and cultures.

8636E0C6280B425C8AB1B7A370C62277.description: Develop informed, reflective and engaged participation essential for a democratic society, recognizing that media is a part of culture and function as agents of socialization (NAMLE).

082265553EC74EDEA59FC7B54409606F.description: Use a variety of tools to capture, create and modify digital images, audio and video content.

45E045B9391D4B0E8507595A1135ADEE.description: Individually or in a collaborative group, effectively communicate a specific message to a target audience using various media formats.

D0A5488729DF439EAC772BEFC3E47A2A.description: Create and effectively share a message using your personal experiences and cultural views.

5EFEC70FCB1B4C81A7B6E19F512E0866.description: Provide and take feedback to collaborate with peers using a variety of media formats.

FF5118BC4F1640D4A44DE14A9E9648AD.description: Create and accomplish a purpose using audio or video recording tools.

B74F2F80BE9B45B4A51BB199A18F7C4E.description: Develop a message, alone or in a group, select an appropriate medium and create a message that meets a particular audience’s need.

6FCC15F7F58545AB80A52FBA96D4F11A.description: Identify and analyze design elements of various media sources and their impact on purpose.

304C5621907B406A82347BA429F390E3.description: With guidance, ask good questions to evaluate the authors’ or creators’ credibility.

C8AF6B2B95824D2FA94086449040C8CE.description: Identify biases and distinguish between fact and fiction in various media sources.

416A66F13D5944C49921A7DFE4EF4DE8.description: Expand knowledge about the authors’ or creators’ works and creative processes.

75FBFB0CE9734203A496226CAF58F47B.description: Discuss how the authors’ or creators’ purpose affects an individual’s interpretation of their media source.

74B23FA1097C47A8934D0A0F928F948C.description: Discuss how various media messages make everyone feel and explain how the author or creator evoked that feeling.

9DC818D0AF87489590C1542388657C6B.description: Identify the purpose for which each media source was created. (e.g., commercial, educational, graphics, pictures, etc.) Give evidence to support your position or thesis.

871F65458EE84BBE94C9928D835F6B07.description: Analyze and evaluate media formats and messages for accuracy, validity, social and emotional context and appropriateness for need.

4C5E72579CA84302A82A3EE984AB4A6E.description: Understand that resources are more than text; actively seek videos, audio or websites to meet personal and educational needs.

915CAB0F9E0B4445938518E055444354.description: Evaluate the quality of sources given librarian-set criteria.

83F37138D0594E8F8C63176337E10666.description: Compare and contrast multiple formats’ treatment of a subject.

4EA9357AA98B4F0497E35FB382985C3C.description: Understand the elements of design, criteria for quality and differences between formats.

501D3033357C4DD2AD070E459293B5D8.description: Engage with multiple media formats at school and at home including search engines and databases.

9421E1F1967F4AF78AD88D8C5C28E12A.description: With guidance, discuss how authors’ and creators’ messages are affected by their diverse backgrounds and beliefs.

92525B48DAB244399D51646A87A295EE.description: Identify many different types of authors and creators (filmmakers, web designers, comic artists, illustrators, animators), and understand how their media format affects their treatment of their subject.

D280F7374FE14D309EDCB6ACC41C10AF.description: Identify the purpose and understand how authors adjust their messages for a target audience.

1589C764C7BD47FEA9C2C9D8956FEB11.description: Explore the world of information for personal and educational use through a variety of formats.

88F112CA81FB46AB9EF0330E2742A22C.description: According to National Association for Media Literacy Education (NAMLE), “Media literacy is the ability to ACCESS, ANALYZE, EVALUATE, CREATE, and ACT using all forms of communication. In its simplest terms, media literacy builds upon the foundation of traditional literacy and offers new forms of reading and writing. Media literacy empowers people to be critical thinkers and makers, effective communicators and active citizens.” (NAMLE, 2017).

105FDFB18299475CA0D1429E6ED2398D.description: Reflect how information from print and digital resources is used during the inquiry process.

C962D30D248848CA92D2AC12903A2C1D.description: Brainstorm how to use information from selected print and digital resources during the inquiry process.

57287A38B370416298ABD8B0C9C9474D.description: Discuss new questions and topics to be explored in the next research unit.

7F4DE5F03FF04F3CA87CD95394DD78DD.description: Reflect on the topic of inquiry with guided questions from the librarian.

D391C33BC1D14B37811674E0A885D769.description: Develop questions for further exploration and to extend learning. Reflect on the collection, research, collaboration and application of information from multiple types of sources.

459F349DA3EE4E24A78F1CE818538D6A.description: Select and use multiple communication tools and resources.

51E0B4D0310A45DBB14F241A0703FC37.description: Seek and provide feedback to peers and adults.

0F4C94E79E54462A86C966D2726A4F6C.description: Create products for an intended audience.

338DF9E07C09482592E77A7065B54C2F.description: Recognize the need to cite and list sources used in research.

48CF942AD2984DAA8C3E031DAAA8F680.description: Contribute to a group solving a problem together.

C8335EBF54E541FD92741934869F1E8B.description: Create and distribute information with others in an inclusive environment.

44FEE7DDE6B345219BB80FDEA65AEDA3.description: Read closely for details to support key ideas.

64640313E3F6425A8DC2DAA1CA7A8251.description: Select evidence from text to answer information needs.

F528EC27223140EAB2DC49C2392F9247.description: Examine different methods to collect and sort information.

6E94BDBF9D3B4A2D98C310D1B46FA77D.description: Record, classify and use information and resources in a meaningful way.

9E8D3976D1F04EFAA2DD7659FC0F2ABA.description: Describe how to document or cite information.

C5B1274F456E48FEBC0BECA9BF8D7E59.description: Use, synthesize and evaluate a variety of sources.

3730A98B10DC406A946DFEC51A44DD3A.description: Identify strategies to narrow or broaden a search.

98F1856BF77844E4B920D4080C57DC2B.description: Select text evidence to answer questions and support claims.

FF3F77E5B0F744EDB762DB03ADF9921A.description: Conduct a short research project using a research process model.

86DA24180ABD4BBDAA195315F42FCC2D.description: Use resources to search and evaluate information in a safe, legal and ethical manner.

DF5952990F6D4EC78AFB5BCAD6333F42.description: Explain why the research topic or problem is important.

06DC18FF274249BE80D8D0AAF85C9248.description: Reflect on prior knowledge to add context to the research findings.

27C357127F084D14B377C298E10E50C0.description: Formulate research questions about a topic or problem.

17789D4521B74047A0DB92B5FF33C335.description: Choose which parts of a topic or problem will be researched.

E6D728B2C11B46978A029B65A4EB3B7C.description: Deepen curiosity and inquiry by considering prior knowledge, learning interests and the broader context before setting research goals and forming a research plan.

164C0EC1C7BB4019A228A829F6718DAB.description: Learners recognize when information is needed and can locate, evaluate, search and use information effectively (American Library Association, 2019).

97BE67308AB24C3A81DAFFE262E94D9E.description: Use reading as a springboard for inspiring change.

C491B368310345D481CCC8120D200603.description: Discuss important messages of stories and share favorite books, authors and characters.

FCFD29005A4F450FAA8B40FEB260FCC1.description: Make connections to personal experiences and the experiences of others.

684BB207EC404C06B2FA08D3428CEB34.description: Read, view and listen to a range of resources for a variety of purposes (to live the experience of a character, answer questions, find out about something new, explore personal interests).

ACFB681E9F9D4376B5120C9BFCB88BDE.description: Identify different genres and apply recommended reading, viewing and listening strategies for each genre.

271654C486654EBAB628C084DBE3AA65.description: Set and communicate criteria for selecting materials to read, view and listen to for personal growth.

52F9761E37554354BA4681248C1408F3.description: Read while considering previous reading experience and personal viewpoints.

FAEE3ECD37744C85939AE7FB6D8544E0.description: Use a library materials management system to select materials and read for information, enjoyment and personal growth.

E92D72EB689B4630A4CB6243F53A26C3.description: Select materials, read, empathize, reflect and share ideas to pursue personal growth and improve society.

8F5F4F7CA505420EA19E2060C940DD0F.description: Learners select materials, read, empathize, reflect and share ideas to pursue personal growth and to improve society.

FA3C2319DB3E47B786AF607FBC3AD82E.description: FOUNDATIONS FOR LIFELONG LEARNING AND LITERACY

5D8CA1D0ACCE47508AA2F39D4649B930.description: Describe the fair use of downloading, sharing or modifying digital artifacts.

B8EE985F67B64C89840FC694805E186A.description: Discuss copyright and the inappropriate use of digital artifacts.

8B83BD1E4977423989854AED7E614C14.description: Differentiate between digital artifacts that are open or free and those protected by copyright.

685002481B15440DB253A819322EE2EE.description: Practice using computers, peripheral devices and resources as outlined in the school’s digital pledge and other rules.

4C7FA25021DC45C5860EF37E75CF6764.description: Use digital tools ethically and responsibly.

A5A9BAD6D66243A8A994C03CBC03E3A4.description: Describe safe internet practices and how to avoid risks and dangers associated with online communications.

076D3A909B8D49B28261E74861CBB3C4.description: Discuss how and when to report cyberbullying or other inappropriate content.

701307CB7E96485890C4D14453D55E35.description: Identify different types of cyberbullying (harassment, flaming, excluding people, outing, impersonation).

7FF76CA9EE59405999FC7BDD93201336.description: Describe the need to protect and keep personal information private (name, location, phone number, home address).

23B5F9DFDB934687A7B59BB6B6C20772.description: Follow rules of personal privacy and safety when using the internet and collaborating with others.

DC93100AAAF34890A29AAF0D4B2CE953.description: Use collaborative electronic tools to create media products.

1AA9FEE3FA2B4FBB87A2B6CBCD647813.description: Create an artifact that answers a research question.

D658C5E0E36C4AE2A786A1D17B322CCA.description: Demonstrate basic research skills to produce digital artifacts and attribute credit.

276055727EB148AD982413F801D5A8FC.description: Use digital tools to communicate and exchange information.

6FFCBEA63CCF4458AB2D1907521B6DBA.description: Use digital tools (local and online) to produce digital artifacts.

67AA3B6922774C5895C0A84274197232.description: Use tools to create, manipulate, analyze, edit, publish or develop digital objects.

D273DC32FAB54202AAF09F2022D76CC2.description: Learners use technology to find, evaluate, create and communicate information across disciplines in the school and beyond.
